results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: BFI, John Hall and Jack Gold
results.brief_description: A searching study of suburban futility. Shows in painstaking and intricate detail the chilling, deadening aimlessness of an unmarried woman’s existence - an existence divided between the exhausting monotony of machine-minding and the nervous strain of caring for her stolid, vacant, fractious parents. The routine is broken by a relative’s telephone call wanting to pay a visit and introduce his fiancee. For Alice the natural behaviour of the young couple is a revelation, bringing home to her, her own desperate situation and the implacable passage of time. Cast includes: Alice Spaul, Eunice Phelps, George Wood.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: Paul, a young French Canadian, is caught between two ways of life, and must choose for himself between the old and the new. After a two year absence, Paul returns to the Quebec village where he grew up. His father hopes he will stay and take over his boat-building trade. Despite family ties, Paul sees the inevitable change that is coming to the province and responds to the stronger call of the industrial world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Bernard Devlin

results.title: The Virgin suicides [DVD]
results.creator_credit: American Zoetrope, Paramount Classics, Muse productions, Francis Ford Coppola, Julie Costanzo, Dan Halsted, Chris Hanley and Sofia Coppola
results.brief_description: Sofia Coppola’s feature debut is an elusive and intoxicating work about the beautiful Lisbon sisters, five teenage girls who mysteriously and tragically decide to end their lives. Based on Jeffrey Eugenides cult novel, the story of these girls is filtered through the idealized eyes of the boys in their neighbourhood, who, years later, try to make sense of the Lisbon sisters lives and deaths. Coppola captures perfectly the essence of a difficult book which is as much about the disintegration of idealism in the 70’s as it is about the joys and pains of adolescence. Working with potentially dark material, Coppola appropriately infuses the film with a sense of nostalgic longing that is both seductive and melancholy. Narrated by Giovanni Ribisi. Cast includes: Kirsten Dunst, James Woods, Kathleen Turner, Josh Hartnett, Michael Pare, Scott Glen and Danny DeVito.

constellations_other.name: Iconic creative partnerships
constellations_other.description: Actor Nicholas Hoult and writer-director Tony Mcnamara worked on The Favourite together before Hoult was cast in The Great. Strong creative partnerships between particular actors and directors are the backbone of screen creativity.

results.title: The Violinist
results.brief_description: An animated spoof of the old saying - to create great music the artist must suffer. Harry, the street violinist, makes music which dismays even his own dog. He tries everything, including music lessons but his music does not improve until he takes advice and begins to suffer.

results.title: The Violin maker of Cremona
results.brief_description: A warm tale of love, desire and selflessness when a young violin maker forgoes winning the hand of Giannina and allows the young apprentice who Giannina loves, to win the violin competition and marry Giannina. Cast includes Herbert Prior, Mary Pickford, Owen Moore, David Miles, Harry Solter, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Villagers
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Derrick Knight, Bernice Nassauer and Peter Neal
results.brief_description: In Senegal, youthful villagers are sent off to learn simple new things in a government course and then returned to their own towns to teach their skills to the rest of the people. In Indonesia, French agronomists teach the “Green Revolution” to the whole region and set up a co-op to purchase machinery and guarantee a market for rice. And in Peru, a Government begins a land reform program in spite of the suspicions of those whom it is designed to help.

results.title: The Village turned out
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and John Armstrong
results.brief_description: A dramatic episode in the story of the British lifeboat service, ending with a thrilling rescue at sea. We witness the naming ceremony of a new lifeboat in the Cornish village of Coverack. Various members of the volunteer crew are seen going about their daily work. Then suddenly, at twilight, the boat is called out and the whole village turns out to watch the launching. After a search, during which night falls, a crashed training aircraft is located and its crew of two are saved.

results.title: The Village that vanished beneath the Nile
results.creator_credit: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
results.brief_description: The building of the Aswan Dam on the Nile necessitated the resettlement of the 45,000 people of Wadi Halfa - a town on the border of Egypt and the Sudan. Shows traditional Arab life along the river, and the movement of the people 800 miles south.

results.title: The Village of round and square houses
results.brief_description: Based on a folktale about a village in Central Africa situated in the forest at the base of an active volcano. At the bottom of Naka Mountain is the Tos Village where the women live in round houses and the men live in square house. This film explains some of the villager’s customs, as well as how they came to live in their separate societies. Based on the book by Ann Grifalconi.
